Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday May 16), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script: i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, may 16th. google is shaking up the ai landscape with its latest announcement. the tech giant has unveiled gemini, an advanced ai model designed to revolutionize how businesses integrate ai into daily operations. sundar pichai, google's ceo, is emphasizing the transformative potential of this new technology, suggesting it could lead to more efficient systems across various sectors. moving onto meta, ceo mark zuckerberg has revealed that the company is launching a dedicated virtual workspace platform named horizon workrooms. this comes as the metaverse-driven company seeks to capture a larger share of the hybrid work market, promising innovative tools aimed at improving collaboration and productivity in a virtual environment. meanwhile, amazon's shares are in the spotlight today, following its quarterly earnings report. despite rising operational costs, the e-commerce giant posted a surprisingly strong performance, beating analysts' expectations on both revenue and profit. the company's cloud division, aws, continued to be a significant driver of these impressive figures, even amid tightening competition. that’s all for today. we’ll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, may 16th. google is making waves in the ai world with its latest announcement. the tech behemoth has unveiled gemini, a cutting-edge ai model set to transform how businesses integrate ai into their operations. sundar pichai, google's ceo, is highlighting the model's potential to drive efficiency across various sectors.

over at meta, ceo mark zuckerberg announced the launch of horizon workrooms, a dedicated virtual workspace platform. as the metaverse-driven company aims to capture a larger slice of the hybrid work market, it's promising innovative tools to enhance collaboration and productivity in a virtual setting.

meanwhile, amazon's shares are under the spotlight today following its latest quarterly earnings report. despite facing rising operational costs, the e-commerce giant delivered a strong performance, surpassing analysts' expectations on both revenue and profit. amazon's cloud division, aws, played a significant role in these impressive results, maintaining its momentum amidst increasing competition. 

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-280 Google's Gemini Ai Unveiled 🤖, Meta's Virtual Workspaces 🚀, Amazon's Earnings Surprise 📈
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for friday, may 16th! today's episode dives into the key developments in the tech realm:

  • google's ai revolution: unveiling of gemini, a cutting-edge ai model poised to revolutionize business operations, as highlighted by ceo sundar pichai.
  • meta's venture into virtual workspaces: launch of horizon workrooms by ceo mark zuckerberg, aiming to enhance collaboration and productivity in the hybrid work market.
  • amazon's financial spotlight: despite rising costs, amazon surpasses expectations in its latest earnings report, with aws driving significant revenue and profit gains.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image set against a futuristic urban skyline at dawn, with soft hues of pink and orange illuminating the sky. in the foreground, a sleek, humanoid robot with intricate circuitry and luminescent eyes symbolizes google's gemini ai, gazing attentively into the distance. next to the robot, a virtual reality headset floats, projecting a holographic workspace filled with floating screens and collaborative tools, representing meta's virtual workspaces. on the right, a towering digital stock chart rises, showing a positive trend with symbols of dollar signs and a shopping cart subtly integrated, symbolizing amazon's earnings surprise. these elements are harmoniously woven together, showcasing the intersection of artificial intelligence, virtual collaboration, and economic innovation in a seamless and modern composition
